main event: A flashing ground-to-blue/white sky object was observed, which changed directions, hovered, then accelerated and disappeared.
interesting points: The object was a brightly flashing light or object, possibly an unidentified flying object.
The object was seen on radar and then visually observed, with a large silver object with red lights on it, approximately 40 feet in diameter and not more than a mile and a quarter from observers.
The object was at an altitude of about 3000 feet and headed southwest before disappearing from sight.
A diagram or illustration shows a hemispherical view of the sky with various time markings and angles indicated.
The report includes handwritten notes and details about the sighting, including the time, location, witnesses, and a description of the observed object.
sighted object: A brightly flashing light or object, possibly an unidentified flying object
